definition: arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: This project needs people's support and the development creates commitment.
sentences.chinese: 項目廣聚人脈，發展凝聚人心。

sentences.english: Consultants make money from selling what they know and whom they know.
sentences.chinese: 顧問們通過出售他們所知道的以及他們的人脈來掙錢。

sentences.english: Union got the land because it had the cash and the connections, Huo said.
sentences.chinese: 霍先生說，因爲有現金和人脈，優聯才能得到土地。

sentences.english: You hear about fantastic networking opportunities second- or thirdhand.
sentences.chinese: 你會輾轉聽到拓展人脈關係的美妙機會。

sentences.english: Mr. Fink's Rolodex reaches deep into Wall Street, and Washington.
sentences.chinese: 芬克的人脈遍及華爾街和華盛頓。

sentences.english: "Michael" has connections, and he's able to do much less work than her.
sentences.chinese: “麥克”的人脈很廣，他的工作量比高笛瓦勒少多了。

sentences.english: It is to be able to adopt this platform, patulous oneself person arteries and veins.
sentences.chinese: 三是可以通過這個平臺，擴展自己的人脈。

sentences.english: But Haiti was the only sending nation with which we had a personal connection.
sentences.chinese: 但是，海地是我們唯一存在人脈關係的兒童輸出國。

sentences.english: I don't know or have connections with the Ministry of Culture.
sentences.chinese: 我對文化部一無所知，也沒有什麼人脈關係。

sentences.english: Networking is also critical, says Ms. Marks.
sentences.chinese: 馬克斯還說，人脈也至關重要。

definition: undertaking/project/activity/(charitable, political or revolutionary) cause/publicly funded institution, enterprise or foundation/career/occupation/CL:個|个[ge4]
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
every trade/all professions/all walks of life
